snippet: The baby, born in rural Mississippi, was treated aggressively with antiretroviral drugs starting around 30 hours after birth; if further study shows this treatment works, it will almost certainly be recommended globally.
abstract: Doctors announce that baby born in rural Mississippi has been cured of HIV infection after being treated aggressively with antiretroviral drugs starting around 30 hours after birth, something that is not usually done;  startling development, if confirmed after further study, could change how infected newborns are treated and sharply reduce number of children living with virus that causes AIDS.

byline.original: By ANDREW POLLACK and DONALD G. McNEIL Jr
